trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_SEQ_00<tab>Oul Sigun thirsts for your kindness.
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_TODO_01<tab>Give the water to the leafmen.
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_000<tab>Mortal, mortal, hear my plea! Our precious children are thirsty, and I need you to bring them water.
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_001<tab>Who are our children, you ask? Why, they're the leafmen you see standing about our village. Adorable, aren't they?
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_002<tab>Now, you'll need to go to Longmirror Lake to draw the water. Once you have it, see that our children have a good drenching.
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_003<tab>Oh, but be warned: the Fuath make their home in the lake. They tend to play rough, so have care!
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_010<tab>They may look alike to strangers, but to us each of our children is unique and special!
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_BALLOON_000_021<tab>You want water? We'll give you a lungful!
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_030<tab>You've given water to our children? Thank you ever so much!
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_031<tab>They're all very dear to us. They wandered into Il Mheg as stray mortals, but we grew attached to them and decided to take them in.
TEXT_LUCKMB108_03309_OULSIGUN_000_032<tab>You and yours would've been our children too, but the enchantment didn't catch as well as we'd hoped. It's never too late of course...
